author: morningstar.com
title: Credits & Debits
text:
(FROM THE WALL STREET JOURNAL 9/15/15) By Kimberly S. Johnson
-- CSX Corp., a railroad operator based in Jacksonville, Fla., named Frank Lonegro finance chief. He replaces Fredrik Eliasson, who was named chief sales and marketing officer.
-- Crocs Inc., a Niwot, Colo., footwear maker, said Chief Financial Officer Jeff Lasher, left the company. Mr. Lasher will join West Marine Inc. a Watsonville, Calif., seller of boating gear and water-related apparel.
-- MillerCoors, a joint venture between London-based SABMiller PLC and Denver-based Molson Coors Brewing Co., named Gavin Hattersley chief executive. Mr. Hattersley was interim CEO and CFO at Molson Coors Brewing. He succeeds Tom Long, who retired.
-- Docker Inc., a closely held San Francisco-based enterprise software company, named Mike Gupta CFO. Mr. Gupta was CFO of Twitter Inc. when it went public in 2013.
-- FireEye Inc., a Milpitas, Calif., cybersecurity company, named Michael Berry CFO. Mr. Berry succeeds Frank Verdecanna, who has been interim CFO since July. Mr. Berry joins FireEye from Informatica Corp., a software and services company where he was CFO.
-- Array BioPharma, a Boulder, Colo., biopharmaceutical company, named Patricia Henahan finance chief. Ms. Henahan joins from Hospira Inc., where she was vice president of finance of the company's pharmaceutical business. She succeeds David Horin, Array's interim CFO since February.
-- Express Scripts Holding Co., a St. Louis-based pharmacy-benefits manager, named Eric Slusser as CFO. Mr. Slusser most recently was finance chief of Gentiva Health Services Inc., which earlier this year was acquired by Kindred Healthcare Inc.
-- Vita Coco, a closely held coconut-beverage company, named Armando Amselem global finance chief. Mr. Amselem joins the New York-based company from PepsiCo Inc.
-- Madison Square Garden Co. a New York-based media, sports and entertainment company, named Bret Richter finance chief of MSG Networks Inc., the media entity it plans to spin off later this month. Mr. Richter joins from Cablevision Systems Inc., where he was executive vice president of corporate finance and development.

 14, 2015 19:57 ET (23:57
